Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav played some special shots, including a six that sailed into the three Ws stand
Jasprit Bumrah struck off his second ball against Afghanistan and finished with 3 for 7
Rashid Khan starred with the ball for Afghanistan but their batters fell short against India's attack
Pre-Game Insights: India have ditched the safety-first approach and are now open to batting in a different way
Suryakumar Yadav mans the No. 4 position and has been trusted to play his natural game
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav admitted that he was nervous but knew he couldn't let himself be bogged down
India do not want to fall into the same traps as before and are going to bat like they have a full ten wickets to spare
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch, once again, was tough to bat on: slow and offering purchase to everyone willing to roll their fingers across the ball
Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma did not play a single T20I between the end of the previous World Cup in 2022 and January this year
Others: Kuldeep Yadav picked up 2 for 32, Axar Patel began with a wicket-maiden in the powerplay, and Arshdeep recovered from a two-over spell for 22 runs to almost pick up a hat-trick in the dying moments
